### About
An API that provides names for colors based on their hex value

### üîß How it Works

This workflow converts the Color Name API API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

‚Ä¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
‚Ä¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to https://api.color.pizza/v1/
‚Ä¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
‚Ä¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent

### üìã Available Operations (4 endpoints)

**Lists (1 operations)**
get

**Names (1 operations)**
get

**Swatch (1 operations)**

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Authentication**: No authentication required

3. **Activate Workflow**: Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**: Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration

### üí° Usage Notes

‚Ä¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
‚Ä¢ With 4 API endpoints available as tools
‚Ä¢ Responses maintain original API structure
### üõ†Ô∏è Customization

‚Ä¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
‚Ä¢ Implement custom error handling
‚Ä¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

‚Ä¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed
